column26: most of which you can find online in case you

predominantly for nostalgic reasons.

The music for the game is probably one of the few redeeming factors. It's actually pretty catchy and suitable considering how terrible most things about the game are.

Overall

reviewText: At a point I was lost in my life, but I found hope. You poor misguided people, put down whatever game you've been playing and go to the true GOTY of every year ever. the game I am talking about is Bad Rats. With a heart-wrenching story about the terrible battle between cats and vermin, you play as a team of wily, interesting rats with a wide set of skills and personalities. Using interpretive logic, solve intricate puzzles using the developer's inconsistent physics engine" which means that any given scenario can have as many as 5
hoursPlayed: due to a huge database of random-number generators. Sometimes
voteText: the developer-given solutions will fail
helpfulPercent: giving the player a feeling of empowerment as they are forced to solve the puzzle themselves. The graphics
votesHelpful: which appear 2.5D (a platformer rendered in a 3D world) the game is actually fully rendered in 3 dimensions. Sometimes
votesTotal: the ball (your puzzle-solving mechanic) will move along the z-axis
votesFunny: making it untouchable by your incredible band of rats. The heart-pounding action of pressing the "reset" button and waiting to see the outcome was almost too much for me to bear. In the end
commentsCount: I was forced to quit the game early
column16: as the intense graphics burned out my computer (64 gigs of ram) as the game takes up processing room like Far Cry: 3 on Ultra * Sniper Elite: 3 on Authentic - Half Life 3 on Easy. Needless to say
column17: the graphical input was too much for my mortal mind
column18: and I now have lost sensees in my right eye and both ears. I think anyone who has not tried this game is missing the best thing in this world
column19: and possibly in the next. God himself is a dim blink compared to the shining star of Bad Rats.\n\n100/10"

reviewText: Bad Rats is about your endless struggle to take back what was once your own. The cats have launched an invasion and it's up to you and your fellow mouse to hold the line. You are brave, you are daring but most importantly you have the memory of your sweet Mouse children and your loving mouse wife to keep you going, the mice you fight along side are all very well thought out and each of them has a special set of quests you can do which will allow them to be better figthers and trust you more, the enemy have many special units such as the Pantherak which is like a Panzer but it looks like a cat. The online community is extremely active and you'll find nothing but nice players to help you in your struggle to hold back Catzies and save the innocent Mice they're killing off. GOTY, GOTD, GOTM. Don't forget to pick up the DLC missions, they go more into detail about how the Cat overlords decided that the mice were a threat to the Utopia project and needed to be prunned. 10/10, would pretend to have played again.

reviewText: Bad Rats is a RPG FPS shooting game.You won't believe whats in store! This game has graphics inspired by Battlefield 3 and physics inspired by Half Life 2. The intense dialouge and riveting combat system never lets you down, niether does the amazing plot. I can't say this plot, it'll spoil the whole game! Just know that there will be a lot of hard choices to make in the game and some choices may have horrible consequences. Now, the combat system, man I can't tell you how many times I've exhaled in arousal from the amazing combat. It is highly unique and you won't see it anywhere else! I gave my friend this game, and he was SO happy he accidentally unfriended me and forgot to add me back (he seems to not be responding to my calls either but I'll look into that)! Give your bestest friend this game and he will want to ♥♥♥♥ you, I swear.\n\n10/10 help me

reviewText:
Rats Gone Bad (GONE SEXUAL) - An Official Waffle King Review
~Find more here.[www.nonm.co.uk]

There are good games. And there are bad games. Not every game is good. Not every game can be enjoyable. Sometimes things just don't work out. Sometimes the people behind it mess up. Sometimes there are people in suits, bad people, that force everyone to make it ♥♥♥♥♥♥. Sometimes the people making it have a disorder, where they refuse to let anyone interfere with their vision. But their vision was caused by having no friends as a kid, and their intense Oedipus complex due to never getting laid even though they're in their 30's. Yup, some games just never work out.


Bad Rats is that kind of game. It's clear that there was some kind of vision there. But not the clearest vision. Whoever thought this up might've been staring into the sun for too long. Or tried to make lemonade but used salt instead of sugar, and then got waterboarded with that.


An interesting little, uh... happening. Bad Rats is a wonky little PC physics game, and a legend on Steam. Bad Rats has transcended regular games. This is a full-blooded, full-bodied meme. This is a meme. You're being memed. We're all being memed on. Worshiped as a god among memes, Bad Rats goes where no meme has gone before. Into your wallet. Unless you buy meme shirts from Hot Topic but if that's the case I'm afraid you're beyond saving already.


Bad Rats isn't actually THAT bad of a game. It's a mediocre physics puzzle game. Use the various random junk to build a little Rube Goldberg-esque machine to kill a cat. Simple premise. Not exactly executed well, of course. But I mean, they had their heart in the right place. You got brutally ♥♥♥♥♥ by a group of guys. They yanked you out of your car and, you know, went at it. No one listened to your cries for help. You're pregnant with their child now and are haunted by options, thoughts of aborting your child, raising your ♥♥♥♥♥♥'s child, or just emptying out your medicine cabinet to fill the emptiness you feel inside you... And then Bad Rats comes along with a little It's a Boy!" balloon and a card with 5 dollars in it. Maybe some gas station coffee. They tried to cheer you up. They were trying.


Bad Rats is plagued by a number of issues. Uninspired puzzles
recommended:
and its inexplicable... style.


There's something genuinely uncomfortable about the game. The awkward animations and graphics look somewhere between an amateur school project a kid in a 3D modeling class made
voteText:
and low-quality 3D modeled porn.


The animations are clunky
helpfulPercent: the game's poorly executed gore really just makes you cringe
votesHelpful: and the general atmosphere is like that of a swingers club for the mentally disabled. The first time I knocked a safe onto a cat and saw its little orange blob of a body implode and shoot blood and internal bits everywhere
votesTotal: I felt dirty and uncomfortable. Like I'd accidentally downloaded snuff porn or something and watched it in front of my mom. It wasn't really funny in that over-the-top gore kind of way. It wasn't super satisfying. It wasn't even horrifyingly grotesque like a Mortal Kombat fatality. It was like cracking your little brother over the head with a metal folding chair
votesFunny:
like they do on TV. But then he doesn't wake back up. The game is just completely tone deaf.


For a lot of people
commentsCount: this game would be a waste of a dollar. For a lot of people. Not everyone though. Not everyone has a sense of shame. Of indecency. They'll sleep with a hooker and dump her right on the side of the road in the middle of nowhere
column16:
fully knowing it was their teenage cousin trying to pay off her art school loans.


It's like a really bad car wreck. Some people will drive right past
column17: keeping their eyes on the road. Most will slow down
column18: just to get a good look. They want their fill of human dismemberment before speeding away. But some people will drive even slower
column19: polishing their knob furiously as they see limbs strewn about. They salivate with lust at the corpse of what may be a guy or girl
column21: impaled by sharp metal pieces. They didn't go painlessly. They're disfigured horribly
column22: their bones cracked and crunched up
column23: protruding from their skin. But these people will drive by real slow
column24:
waving to the police as they drool all over the wreckage. This is what they live for.


Bad Rats is not the right game for a lot of people. You might figure it's not bad for a dollar. You might give it a chance. But you will regret it. When you're at the gates of the beyond
column25: throwing open their mighty golden doors only to be greeted with emptiness and darkness
column26: that is what Bad Rats is. The realization that life is empty and unfair. That even death cannot save you from a life of futile struggling
column27:
for the torment will follow you into the nothingness of the void.


Only those truly sick
column28: those who've looked eternal suffering in the face and giggled with glee
column29: only they will revel in this cluster♥♥♥♥ of mangled limbs and broken souls. Memes
column30: they'll say. You've all been memed. They'll buy you ten copies of the game as a gift
column31: and laugh hysterically. It's all a game to them. They'll look you in the eye as you boot it up
column32: climaxing as a bitter cold consumes your very being. The inner light within you
column33:
extinguished.


I could warn you to stay away
column34: but really it's no use. You'll find yourself in possession of Bad Rats one way or another. Like rats carrying bubonic plague
column35: gnawing at the corpses of all you love and hold dear
column38:
crawling under your bed and between your sheets as you sleep.


There's no escape from the pain. They will nibble away at you for eternity
column39: even in death. There's no escape."

Bad Rats on the other hand is in stuck between--its crude quality and blunt effort made into the game keeps this game's value in between being poorly made and best at its value--It's just absolutely BAD. Is there a mystery to it? To answer your question
column20: assuming your eyes aren't sore already after my first sentence
column21: this game is a monumental symbol of where it is at--to take this seriously is up to how you perceive my opinion below.\n\nBad Rats is arguably one of those memetic infectious existence being in our game library. Aside from that guy who bought the Bad Rats first before others
column22:
we simply didn't buy the game because we bought it for what games usually are consumed as--for fun. Probably the main reason why it sits at your game library is because:

1. You heard about it and you want to know about it.

2. Your friend gifted it to openly express that your friend hates you.

3. You spent all your money on good game and the left over in your Steam Wallet can actually afford Bad Rats.

4. Other reasons. (I don't know--fan of rats? fan of murdering cats in most sinister rendition?)

After a careful thought
column23: I have come to a conclusion that Bad Rats
column25: represents the Plague of our realms in the gaming history. It is no easy matter that the video game history has reflected an interesting parallel reflection of what human race has endured. The quality control ever since the crash of video game market and grim turns of gaming industry has taken in nowadays is strangely similar. Where have these games sprouted in the Steam store and how they managed to root into our game library? For some reason
column26: it is eerie to actually know why this game was made to exist in reality. However
column27: one can assume that this is the creation by the human being and worst part of the reality is that anyone can make such cancerous being in the world--even that 5-year-old Tommy in your neighbourhood.\n\nLet's trace ourselves back to the grim time of Plague
column28: where people simply died without explanation but only the sign of death. most historians would agree that the main reason why Plague deeply damaged the human population was due to lack of understanding how it was transferred and how to maintain hygiene to prevent the spread. Such mysterious yet deadly disease brought a great panic across the commonwealth
column29: causing confusions and ultimately the fear of what it could do to a human being. It wasn't exactly the issue of death because death was inevitable--the only difference was to die happily or cursed. When the demonic black-red rings of death appeared on one's body
column30: you could had only assume that the person was the sinner and has received its terminal punishment. In result the person would be damned by his friends
column31: family and even the doctors and priests garnered in infamous crow masks.\n\nIn our game library
column32: thing is little different than back in the middle age--our game library has been under control in lieu of our judgements
column33: sometimes making foolish mistakes that we would regret. However
column34: Steam store brought a prosperity to literally anyone's game library
column35: even if you had no money to spend on any games. With its constant flow of new and old games easily discounted
column36: our game library can easily grow into bloating collection of games yet to be installed or even be recognized. This easily develop-able habit of buying games on discounts
column38: symbolizes the hardly-controllable growth of infectiously bad games. the numbers slashing across games' presenting values soften our grip on our wallets and easily be fooled into buying the game because it is on sale--such same devious illusion shapes poorly-developed early access games and falsely satisfying your desire of getting ahead of the hastely-expanding (or seemingly so) video game market via pre-orders.  Our senses are dulling and our judgements are loosen. It would be no big surprise that we're heading toward the second great video game market crash. Some may see this as hollow as the Mayan's 2012 Apocalypse while some take it as seriously as whatever the guy with big fat white beard said.\n\nBad Rats in such sense symbolizes our rustic taste of video games nowadays
column39: taking the spoon into the depth of excrete flakes floating on the soup of urine. It is a fair warning that the developer of this game must had in mind
column40: to become the epidemic death crawling within our steam library. I dare say that it is a volatile revolution against the undesirable direction that the video game industry had been indulging out of false satisfaction of gamers. (Press X to Continue)\nThe gameplay and the setting was mere way to present it as the game because what the game symbolizes does not require a weight to its presence--its true value
column42: is to nest within our Steam library along with many other games that we have bought and carelessly thought if we were really going to play back in the time we bought it.\n\nThe overture of pandemic has just started--and what's really scary thing is that we're snickering and pointing fingers at the upcoming horror against what we love to play. When the chain on the bellowing beast's neck be broken? It is truly depressing statement to say that no one really knows where this is going. However

reviewText:
I have bought this game for the majority of my people on my friendas list, and I can honestly say it's the best money I've ever spent. The game itself is actual perfection, I cannot find a single flaw in it. I would gladly have very rough sexual interactions with the creators of this game. Hell, I would pay money to let them have these rough interactions with me. But I digress, I would very much enjoy if the creators of this game would create DLC of some kind for this game. Just so that I can give them more of my money. Though until then, I'll just continue to give copies out to my friends to fill their pockets with my money.
The puzzles in this game are 10/10, I have avoided university due to the fact I am that confident in Bad Rats ability to educate me and keep my brain nice and fresh.

In short, no matter what who you buy this for, it is the perfect gift; your best friend, your online girlfriend, your dying grandmother or your dyslexic cousin, they will all come out of playing this game a better person.
Thank you Bad Rats, for completing my life.
Without you, I would be nothing.
voteText: 8 of 9 people (89%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
I have now played through Invent 4's artistic tour-de-force, 'Bad Rats: the Rats' Revenge' three times. With each playthrough, 'Bad Rats' becomes more complexly entangled in and inseparable from my own life. I no longer know where Bad Rats ends and I begin.

It is, without question, the best game ever made. But this comment is in no way meant to be discouraging. Because while Bad Rats is the best game ever made it is also the easiest way to attain Lou Gehrig's disease. Simply put, 'Bad Rats' will change your life.

It's not just the phenomenal animmation or the fantastical gameplay or the stunning models or the musical score so soaked in post-modern existentialist dubstep remixes of popular 1990's children's cartoons that you will ♥♥♥♥ yourself in auditory delight or the Stevie Wonder-making 2d sprites; no, there is something so magically right with this game that it can only be the product of divine intervention. If you took the greatest game developers in history and gave them all the task of creating a film as magnificent as this, not one of them, with all their knowledge and skill, could make anything that could even be considered as a contender. Not one 24fps 900p rendered Ellen Page hair would rival any painstakingly hand-animated by third-world children pixel in Bad Rats.

The centerpiece of this eureka-inducing Tom Hanks spasm is the Fat Rat. Without it, this would still be the best game ever made, but with it Bad Rats is the greatest best most amazing lifestyle (not a game, mom) ever made. The Fat Rat has been described as a diabetic hippie, a Croatian velociraptor, possibly from Norway, clearly a product of Usimare Ramesses III and Alexander the Great's illigetimate love affair, or maybe even not from this world or dimension. All of these things are true at any one moment (except for the diabetes). It is a tantalizing mystery stuffed inside an enigma wrapped in fur and smothered in pixels. You will fall in love with this rat even as you are repelled by it from the first moment it steps into the game on level 4 with its wide John Candy style love handles and thick bulbous shoulders packed into an oddly fitting 40-polygon model, and its jagged .jpg destroyed texture. The Fat Rat looks out of place, out of time and out of this world. There has never been anything else like it. Nor will there ever be.

Play this game at all costs. Play it twice. Or three times. Or as one grizzled war veteran that I met from Milwaukee has, 12 times! See it until you can recite every precious level password this game masterpiece of modern art has to offer. Let Bad Rats become your new religion and the Fat Rat your prophet preaching the gospel according to Papa John.

My dream is to someday buy an arcade with machines that play nothing but Bad Rats 24 hours a day, 7 days a week until the nearby town disintegrates. I hope it becomes your dream as well.

Sent from my iPhone

reviewText: Perhaps one of the most overlooked gems of our age, Bad Rats will challenge the player on mental and physical planes which he was unaware of. Bad Rats is a fantastic puzzle game. It provides many hours of entertainment. Sure the objective is simple, create a rube goldberg like machine while using the pre determined beams of the level to guide you to victory, but the challenge of the game kicks in. It uses quality, fun puzzles that challenge the mind, yet offer great rewards at the end of it by saying bye bye to cats. Reminds me of a more violent version of Tom and Jerry and we all know how great those classic cartoons were. Bad Rats is a great addition to anyone's game collection, and well worth the price

reviewText: Vermintide takes place in and around Ubersreik, a city overrun by Skaven. You will assume the role of one of five heroes, each featuring different play-styles, abilities, gear and personality. Working cooperatively, you must use their individual attributes to survive an apocalyptic invasion from the hordes of relentless rat-men, known as the Skaven. Battles will take place across a range of environments stretching from the top of the Magnus Tower to the bowels of the Under Empire.

reviewText:
A lot of people gifted me this game and, to be honest, I'm hooked. I believe it.

Bad Rats is probably one of the most imaginative and revoluationary steps the platforming genre has taken in a long time. Some have gone as far as to say it's a spiritual successor to Superman 64, but that's blatant trolling. Why make a pun as poor as that when the most broke ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ could shell out a dime to play 'Bad Rats' and enrich himself? The game, as of now, costs nineteen cents (Euro currency). The value is a million times worth more than your money.

What, you can't run it? Technical issues are persistent if you have Windows Vista or earlier operating sysems, along with functional, user-friendly interfaces like Linux, but installing Windows 7 is worth it for Bad Rats. Honestly. You won't lose a bit of sleep over it, unless you dream about Linux, you f*ggot.

I mean, the first aspect that hasn't received a lot of superlatives, for some ♥♥♥♥ing reason, is the art style. Think of anorexic Roland Rat with bucktooth, and his colleges don certain attire, items or boast physical attributes that constitute their defining features. The Lung Rat is a chain-smoker, most likely a metaphor for the health concerns (not celebrations) of smoking. (Celebrate it if you want, though, it's best to suspend reality in this game). Same with the vacuum rat, a metaphor for fourth-wave feminism and the role of the housewife in the Western world. There are Eastern implications, too; a bomber rat is featured in the game, a rodent who dons a suicide jacket, most likely satirizing Islamic terrorism. Several more rats exist, such as the Archer Rat, Fat Rat (Americans, pay attention), Homosexual Rat, Promiscuous Rat, Hippie Rat, Shitgoose Rat, Moosecock Rat and Happy Rat. The game is textured wonderfully, with memorable characters that make a deep, resounding impact once your ears are open. I believe it.

Plot-wise, there isn't much to say. The game revolves around level-based objectives: you are to solve physics-based puzzles using objects and rats to take revenge on cats. The cat is the antagonist, although it's really up to the gamer to propel the story. Imagination isn't necessary, since this game attracts logical thinkers as well as visualists, but yeah. I believe it.

The gameplay is groundbreaking. I haven't had this much fun playing a platformer since Sonic the Hedgehog 3. I mean, don't get me wrong. Sonic the Hedgehog 3 is COMPLETELY dissimilar to this title. Same with Portal, even though I'm implying this game is the next step. Level-design happens to be one of the factors that changed the face of platform, which is why I'll never be able to look at Sonic the Hedgehog 3 or Portal 2 again. I believe it.

So, the objective of the game is to get the ball from point A to point B (B being the cat, even though a cat isn't called B and if you thought that, then you might as well be illegible) and making use of the rats. One of the unique things about Bad Rats is that it utilizes slopes. Yeah, you'd argue that Sonic had slopes. Portal even had slopes. But rats climb up slopes, and Sonic wasn't a rat, he was a ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ hedgehog that you thought could run super fast. I digress since this is a pub argument, and not a topic worth mentioning in a professional review, but the one mechanic that Bad Rats is dependent on happened to innovate traditional structural platforming forever. And I believe it.

And, plus, the game boldly incorporates violence as you make noble gameplay decisions such as making use of the exploding rats and rocket rats. I mean, it's really funny and all, but, yeah. I believe it.

Plus, Bad Rats has nice music and all. Er, yeah. Not that I'm deaf or anything.

And I can't really say there's anything wrong with it, otherwise the Metascore would be lower.

Regardless? Outstanding. Can't believe I didn't come across Bad Rats any later. Bad Rats is a mesmirizingly smart, unique game that makes you feel really smart when you've finished playing it. Highly recommended for the retrospective, pro, underground and casual gamer scene. This is a title that'll age well.

reviewText:
A truly breathtaking experience and one of the finest puzzle games of its generation, Bad Rats: the Rats' Revenge delivers incredible next-gen physics combined with a beautiful blend of cartoony and realistic graphics in a 2.5d environment.

Bat Rats: the Rats' Revenge also delivers some of the most complex and challenging puzzles in its genre. The mind blowing physics engine always keeps the levels interesting as you never quite know what will happen when you hit play, a true testament to the hyper realistic physics engine.

Sadly, there are two downsides to the game. Firstly, at only a few hours long the game doesn't last as long as anybody would hope and secondly, the sheer quality of the game makes it difficult to play other puzzle games. Once you've played Bad Rats: the Rats' Revenge, there's just nothing that compares. Don't bother with the next-gen consoles this Christmas, do your self a favour and buy Bad Rats: the Rats' Revenge and don't forget to gift all your friends a copy. They'll owe you one.

reviewText: This game... It cannot be described by simple words. It represents the power struggle between the lower classes of society, and those in control. It shows how the organized masses can generate a revolution, while, at the same time, exploring the concept of the revolutionaries becoming as bad (if not worse) than the dictators they managed to overthrow.\n\nAdd to that an exploration into the concept of chaos: how completely similar systems can lead to completely different results. Or is it a modern view on quantum mechanics? After all, the cat is both alive and dead, until the methaphorical box, in this game represented by your mechanism, opens". It's also a path to exploring the nature of mind: we all know the "definition of insanity" that states it's "doing the same thing over and over again expecting different results"
date:
and yet that's what you'll find yourself doing in this game.

This game will change you. It definitely will.

ONE OF US."

reviewText: Seinfeld is an American sitcom that originally ran for nine seasons on NBC, from 1989 to 1998. It was created by Larry David and Jerry Seinfeld, the latter starring as a fictionalized version of himself. Set predominantly in an apartment building in Manhattan's Upper West Side in New York City (although taped entirely in Los Angeles), the show features a handful of Jerry's friends and acquaintances, particularly best friend George Costanza (Jason Alexander), former girlfriend Elaine Benes (Julia Louis-Dreyfus), and neighbor across the hall Cosmo Kramer (Michael Richards). It is often described as being a show about nothing"
date: as many of its episodes are about the minutiae of daily life."

reviewText:
Bad Rats: The Rats' Revenge is set in the year 2083. 5 years prior to the events in Bad Rats: The Rats' Revenge, a human colony on Mars discovered a massive tunnel network 2 miles underground. Believing it to be uninhabited, colonists began exploring the tunnels until one day, the colony suddenly vanished without a trace. News reporters who went to investigate never returned. After 6 days of fruitless searching, another colony disappeared, but this time, our protagonist caught sight of what must be the source of the colonies' disappearance: a huge army of bipedal cats armed with technology far beyond humanity's capability, able to turn humans into rats and alter the laws of physics to suit a cat-friendly environment.

Our protagonist warned the other Martian colonies of the cats, but the warnings are met with intense laughter; no one believed that their pets could've possibly done such a thing. One by one, the colonies disappeared, and before the last one was attacked, our protagonist took a shuttle to Earth to try to warn of their impending doom.

Earth's economy, which depended heavily on raw materials from Mars, collapsed soon after the last colony disappeared, plunging Earth into chaos. Widespread public discontent, rioting, terrorism, suicide incidents, and nuclear war descended upon Earth. As if that wasn't enough, the cats invaded Earth very soon afterwards, turning what was left of humanity into a bunch of rats and enslaving the human population.

Under the cats' rule, the rats suffered dearly. A rat's expected lifespan was in constant decline, from an average of 110 years of age before the invasion to a new average of 20 years. A newspaper, written by our protagonist and titled Bad Rats
date: soon emerged. It called for open revolt against the rule of the cats, arguing that they were exploiting the rats to live their own aristocratic lifestyles. The contents were scoffed by the cats, but the rats soaked in every word of it. From the newspaper stemmed rumors of deportation, torture, mass executions, and anything else that could stir revolutionary fervor. The first incidents of revolt occurred in decentralized acts of terrorism. The cats responded by banning the circulation of Bad Rats
recommended:
tightening their grip over the rats, and starting a process of rendering the rats unable to read or write. This, however, did nothing to contain the rats' growing hatred towards the cats.

On September 13, 2081, the revolution began. An armed mob of rats seized Florida from the cats, inspiring revolts across the entire globe. Rats who were once fighting bitterly among themselves, such as terrorist rats and murican rats, now stood side by side against a common enemy: the cats. After 2 years, the rats were able to seize control of the Americas from the cats, but the cats retained a stranglehold over the rest of the world. Both sides suffered immense casualty rates in the process, and morale dropped sharply on both sides. And the war is just getting started...

To counteract the loss of morale, the rat high command gave the order to set up public executions of the cat POWs. They hired our protagonist to host such events. It is now in your hands to reinvigorate anti-cat sentiment and fuel support for the war effort by elaborately murdering the cat oppressors.

The game focuses heavily on controversial themes, forcing the player to ask why he/she exists and consider the validity of what mankind has accepted as the norm. Featuring unrivaled graphics, cunning level design that will challenge the greatest of minds, a brilliantly orchestrated OST that deserves a live performance at Carnegie Hall, and voice acting that would make Kevin Spacey and Peter Dinklage quit, this piece of artwork is the epitome of gaming and a model that all other developers should follow.

That invent4 is nice enough to sell such a flawless masterpiece at only 99 cents is a sure sign of selflessness despite the fact that the game is worth 2000 times the price of triple A modern releases.

Bad Rats/10 - Buy this game NOW!

reviewText:
Wow.  I am speechless at the amount of work that was put into this INDIE game.  I mean, you have games that take YEARS to develop; this game had to have taken decades.  The pictures on steam do not do this game any justice, those are screenshots at the lowest quality.  Story? Check.  Amazing plot and twists? Check.  Graphics?  If  your computer can even run them, haha.  Super check!  Gameplay?  Some of the most amazing mechanics rivaling high mechanical intensive games such as DOTA2.  Extreme check!!!  Game of the year awards might go to Bioshock Infinite or The Last of Us, but lets be real: we all know what game will receive game of the century ;).

My favorite part was when  the rat kills the cat .

As a patient at Mercy Hospital, I can tell you only having one finger has not allowed me to play many games.  But, with Bad Rats: the Rats' Revenge, I have been able to fully buy a pistol and shoot myself in the head after playing it.

10/10 Highly Recommended.

reviewText: Truly a cult classic and a work that definied an era. Bad Rats is an innovative, visually-pleasing, and tasteful cinematic gaming experience. As you follow the rats on their journey you truly do feel for them and connect with them on an emotional and mental level. This is the true game of the year, nay, the DECADE. Its rich open-world experience, loveable characters, memorable moments, deep, involved lore, and complex combat and crafting, offer so much to the player. The developers toiled day and night to craft this masterwork for us, and it is only right that we give it the spotlight it deserves in an industry so diluted with mindless CoD-clone shooters and interactive movies.

reviewText: Bad Rats is a masterpiece of gaming style and innovation; a true joy that every gamer owes to themselves to play! Only true geniuses would design a game that takes place on a 3D plane but can only be interacted with in 2D! Imagine how good Mario would have been if you could just slip off the front of a block and fall out of the play area! The game revolves around placing various rats of different skill or ability around an obstacle course in order to push a ball into a trap trigger. Doing this kills a cat in the most awkward and not-funny way possible :D The game is setup in a 2D side view (similar to a platformer) for you to plan your setup. your As mentioned earlier, certain impacts can cause the ball to roll backward or forwards, right off the 2D plane; which is... awesome. Add to that the fact that the physics are not consistent, so what may have worked one time may not work the same the next...\n\nSo, to sum things up: 11/10 BUY IT NOW!

reviewText:
Bad Rats is not only a game, but it's a God's gift to gamers, so they could enjoy the greatest experience they had with this beautiful game.

Let's start with the graphics

The graphics look they were made in a very advanced and superior game engine that makes it real life. I actually thought I was watching movie, but those are just the amazing graphics.

The gameplay is just awesome and fun. Your objective is to kill the cat and when you do, you win. The game consists of rats and objects that you have to pick in order to kill the cat. It's challenging and harder than every puzzle game.

The story is spectacular, I almost cried of it's beauty and how it's the only story that is better than Last of Us. The story needs to be made as a book, so people could enjoy reading it.

Overall, I give this game a 10/10. It's ok.
voteText: 10 of 14 people (71%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Bad Rats is a physics puzzle game and your mission is to use your rats to annihilate all cats. While it has a quite unique idea, to use rats with different abilities, it fails at almost everything else.

The tutorial is very short but it explains enough to go on. The UI could have been better but is acceptable. The music is surprisingly quite good while the lack of variety and the rather bad sound effects lower the impression.

Worst of all is the gameplay and it's what destroys every chance for this game to be at least okay. While the game wants to be a physics puzzle game it fails at implementing proper physics. You can rerun your contruction without changing anything and you will get different results. Placing objects is a pain and pixel-precise placement is required for some puzzles but almost impossible to be done.

I really wanted to give this game a fair chance despite the bad things I have heard about it. It was boring in the beginning and got frustrating before I could even finish the easy puzzles.

My advice: Stay away from this game.

Gameplay: 1%

reviewText: Perhaps one of the greatest games of our generation, Bad Rats: the Rats' Revenge combines innovative luck-based gameplay with the utter confusion a 2D game with a 3D physics engine offers into one truly unforgettable experience. Like a fine wine, it becomes better as time passes, and like a great work of art, will permanently exist in the back of people's minds for generations to come, like a million-dollar painting of a soup can, or the Protocols of the Elders of Zion. Truly, Bad Rats: the Rats' Revenge is the best game ever, even better than E.T. and Sonic '06. 10/10 it's okay -IGN

reviewText:
A game that is pretty well know for being fairly bad and there is a lot of truth in that. Its is a physics puzzle game along the lines of The Incredible machine, but it has a lot of issues and the biggest one is how random the physic is. A simple puzzle that involves bouncing the ball against one or more surfaces can work the first time and then fail the next five only to work again without you changing a single thing. This makes a lot of the levels very frustrating as you might be onto the solution but then the physics screw you over but might just be the game being bad then you being wrong.

Achievements overall are pretty well designed to suit the game and are made so you have to think differently on how to solve each level. This is sadly ruined by what I mention above as you just want the game to be over. I recommend checking out the community guides such as:

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=193512250

Time to 100%: 5 hours

reviewText: I can't believe I played this game. I even got a couple of achievements to prove it. My brain literially feels like it slowly turned over the course of playing this game (if can even call it that) into mush. I can barely think right now. I did close to 30 puzzles and I just lost it. I couldn't even think, this game is sooooo bad. Bad Rats is right! It's ungodly baaaaaaaaad. Who made this game? It's almost torture playing this! The graphics are clunky, it's like something out of 1996. This game looks, feels, plays and sounds like one of those pre-installed games you find in a Hewlett-Packard PC back in the mid 90's. The physics in this game are terrible, some of the levels rely on a bit of luck rather than skill. The music is mind numbingly bad, it's stock music that loops. 1/10 for me and I only give it a 1 because it's barely a game.\n\nBE WARNED! I only did this for the cards. If you want cards too, prepare for your mind to go numb and lose all brain functions. Or better yet, buy the damn cards in the market and save yourself the trouble. I'm gonna go lie down....

reviewText:
In Bad Rats you wreck cats with rockets, vacuum cleaners and
Varied other implements all modeled by the hand
Of someone who hates kitties and I'm guessing humans too
'Cause this sadistic monster tried to sell his game to you.

Let's talk about the interface, a work of madness, that.
A pit of grey-furred vermin, foaming, ready to attack
The feline chained up in the basement crying out in fear,
Reminds me of my childhood when I used to- Oh dear...

Back on topic I turn to the open cinematic
Like Video Brinquedo, it's a certain type of magic.
Not like you see in fairy tales, all bravery and love,
It's more  like the Old Testament's apocalyptic flood.

In fact before I played this game I had love and a home
And now I'm living on the streets and sleeping all alone
As my girlfriend walked away she told me she still cared,
But couldn't stand to see me stuck living in this nightmare.

So here I leave a warning that I pray to God you hear:
Don't cry for me, I promise I'm no longer worth your tears.
If there's anything in this world that you feel's still worth seeing
Then flush this turd and move along, become a better being.

~Alias Terror Trousers is still at large, last seen squatting in abandoned factory quietly sobbing to himself. Wanted for various crimes, including public indecency, public intoxication and having played Bad Rats: the Rat's Revenge. Approach with caution, he is armed with knowledge of a darkness no mortal was ever meant to know.

reviewText: One cold December night, I was home alone. It was pouring down rain and I kept hearing noises upstairs in my house. It was freaking me out so, I decided to launch Garry's Mod. I was playing on sandbox server when I heard the doorbell ring. I remebered what my mom always told me, When you're home alone
recommended: so I thought nothing of it. I went about playing my game when I noticed a notification in the bottom right of my screen. Archer Rat
hoursPlayed: has added you to their friends list." I thought
voteText: "what kind of name is that?" and I clicked on his profile. The only game he had on it was "Bad Rats: the Rats' Revenge
helpfulPercent: a game I had never heard of. I accepted the request and immediatly, a gift popped into my inventory. I clicked my inventory and there it was. Bad Rats. My heart stopped. I took off my headset still staring at the screen and that's when I heard a muffled squeak behind me. I turned around in my chair, and Archer Rat and his possy of other Rats were behind me. They nodded at me and the screen, wanting me to play it. I looked at the screen and then denied the gift, then reached for the phone to call for help. Then, the Batter Rat hit me in the head and I don't remember anything else. I awoke in an abandoned factory with Grafitti all over the walls. I looked around the room I was in, and noticed a cage full of yellow-orange cats who looked scared out of their minds. That's when I realized it. I'm in Bad Rats. I had to get out of there. I broke from the string tying me to my chair and ran towards the only exit I could see. I ran to the nearest Police Station and told them my story. They just laughed in my face and told me I need to go home. On my long walk home in the rain, a black SUV with Golden Cheese" shaped rims pulled up next to me. I looked up and the passenger rolled down the window. I could see a long nose and huge teeth under his hoodie. He then

reviewText:
I wake up everyday to leave my house for my daily activities. I hate my daily activies although I keep reminding myself that at the end of this dark tunnel is a holy light filled with enjoyment and happiness.

I commute to my destination and look out the window and re-evaluate my life. Thoughts go through my head, primarily What a miserable life I live. Why am I doing this?". Life's greatest wonder.
This same thought happens throughout the entire day. gradually getting worse to the point where I feel like curling up in the corner and just sleeping for the rest of my life; but I remind myself once again
date: it will get better.\n\nI return home after a lengthy
recommended: depressing day to boot up my 10 year old PC (which takes around 5-7 minutes) to get to my bland green + blue hills wallpaper - the same image I see all day
hoursPlayed:
everyday.

I swivel the ball in my mouse to the black and grey icon. It's labelled "Steam" so I'll call it that. After 15 minutes of Steam loading and updating on my dial-up connection I can only then see the light of my day. I see Bad Rats under the LIBRARY tab.

By this time I would usually be in game; but today is a different day - this is because Bad Rats helps me through the remainder of my day so I strongly believe that it too can help someone else in the same situation as me. I'm writing this while I wait for the game to load so I can play into the night before my computer shuts itself off due to excessive heat or a similar issue.

As I was writing this the power in my home went off so I was left in darkness; pondering to myself if what I just wrote was wasted. I put some clothes on
voteText: stepped over all the bowls
helpfulPercent: plates and feces that is covering the floor
votesHelpful: squeezed out the wooden door then walked 3 miles to the nearest shop where I was able to restore power to my home for a few days
votesTotal: for a large fee. On my way back I rethought about how I was going to write this. And I did lose about 2-3 sentences but I don't feel upset about it as I knew I could come back to eternal peace. After re-entering my home I am finally here writing this.\n\nI do genuinely believe that Bad Rats is a great game and I cannot be more thankful for my friend
votesFunny: Aaron Price
commentsCount: for gifting this to me. Because of him I find the courage to work and earn enough to keep me going."

reviewText:
I don't necessarily believe in organized religion." - Will Smith

9/10 story
The story was very deep. I needed to replay numerous times in order for me to understand. It's about a group of daring rats trying to overcome their fears while living in an oppressive society. The rats all have a backstory
date:
and are all interesting. The description of the game's story is "You have the leader of the Nazi war machine in your sights and one clear shot. Do you have the skill and nerve to take that shot?".

8/10 characters/development
All the characters are extremely relatable. From a timid rodent
recommended:
to a dangerous darerat. They all are changed through the hardships of their adventures. Their interactions with eachother depend on the class you pick during the character customization.

10/10 art/graphics
The art is extremely appealing with its flashy colors
hoursPlayed: and luscious mounds. The graphics are overbearing

even with my 4 titans I could hardly run the game on the lowest quality. You would need the NASA super computer to run this monster.

7/10 gameplay
The character customization is very indepth

reviewText:
If you are looking for an intense physics game you have come to the right place. The unique physics engine keeps the game changing on every attempt! I would easily recommend this to anyone who asked me about it.

Firstly the tutorial, I have never seen such a unique tutorial in my entire life. The game allows you to work out almost everything for yourself which causes the learning curve to be much higher than any modern game. I admire anyone who can complete the tutorial on the first run. There are so many options it is hard to pick one.

Moving on to the levels, the grammar used is flawless and explains the story for each level extremely well. Due to these superb tips you always know where you need to reach in order to complete the level but vague enough to keep the challenge. This is obviously a much better way to go about any game with a story line as it will keep the player engaged and always looking for new ways to achieve the same result. Unlike the popular First Person Shoot-them-up franchise known as Call of Duty, Call of Duty does not allow the player to explore themselves when they are playing the single player for any of the games. There is a set route with multiple waypoints to keep the player on track with how the developers want their game to be played. This is because all of the Call of Duty franchise is aimed at dim-witted teenagers.

The characters in Bad Rats are very original. Sticking with the storyline of the rats having a dastardly plan to kill all cats. This world domination idea is very original and I have never seen it in any other game I have ever reviewed.

The difficulty levels in this game are exactly as they should be. The game will become harder as the difficulty level increases. This is something missing from many games of the current generation as they all want to offer some form of false gratification to all of the people stupid enough to buy their game.

The one flaw with this game is the lack of game-altering DLC. Invent4 Entertainment could you please get on that?

Overall I would rate this game 8/8 for content, 8/8 for graphical design, 8/8 for character development and 9/8 for level design. I can honestly say this was the most fun game I have played in a very long time and you should buy this game now.

reviewText:
Bad Rats is a game that should be played no matter who you are.

The story is engaging and beautiful. You play as Duke Nukem, whose Rhulloian prostitu♥es have been kidnapped by the blatantly-obvious villain Doctor Charlie Sh♥tting, who totally isn't Bobby Kotick wearing a fake goatee. In order to get to the underwater volcano castle in space he calls home, Duke must ally himself with a group of rats trying to kill Dr. Sh♥tting's plethora of Nazi cats, referred to as the Bad Rats Crew. However, his evil Science Machine has totally screwed up physics, making simple tasks such as hitting a baseball a challenge that would stop even a Hispanic super-agent with a magic backpack full of parachutes in his tracks. It's a stretch, but our hedonistic hero will do whatever (and I mean WHATEVER it takes to get his three-eyed alien babes back, even if it means redefining insanity.

The gameplay, however, is bad. Every time you do something, the outcome will ALWAYS be different, explosions have become implosions, and killing the not-actually-that-innocent felines takes a great deal of luck, praying to God/Satan/Allha/Cthulhu/Zeus/Vishnu/Kluex/Skrillex/what-have-you, and sometimes the strategic placement of objects. It's painful to get through levels, but the physics are just so bad they're hilarious. The gameplay suddenly changes on the super-secret hidden final level, which puts you in control of Duke fighting Sh♥tting and his Science Machine with the help of the Bad Rats and their suicide bombing jihadist rats. Surprisingly, this level is not only fun, but excellently done (and probably where all the budget went), although getting through his attack pattern will end in a couple of deaths. Notably, each level gives you 100 tries for some reason. Why 100? I don't know. There are no extra tries anywhere and the amount of tries you have is reset upon entering the next level. The only time the tries meter is actually important is the last level, where it becomes Duke's health meter.

The sound? You're better off replacing it with the gibberish spouted by a drunk Scot while unclogging the toilet that got ruined by many glass shards. While you're at it, replace the music with the Crazy Bus title screen music. The voice acting, though, is top notch, notably with Microsoft Sam's stunning performance as the Announcer. Dr. Sh♥tting's voicework is also notable. Duke's VA is just ripped from the other Duke Nukem games, but the sentence-mixing quality is very good. The final boss music is also much better than the standard theme that plays throughout the game's levels.

TL;DR: The game sucks, but the story and voice acting is incredible and the final level is just good enough to not only save this game, but to make it a masterpiece.

Rating:

reviewText:
My Bad Rats likes to beat people, well, I say people, but I mean kids, innocent, young kids. He gets his best thrills from spanking children, the idea of him being able to dominate young people with no challenge or obstacle in his horizon makes him feel powerful and consistent.
I've had my fair share, across the face, in the stomach, cranked in my leg.
Home is supposed to be safe and secure, warm and snug, loving and caring. But in my case, it's the exact opposite, you can't expect life to be safe and secure with a child abuser living under your roof with the claimed title `Bad Rats`.
You can't expect any love or care from a psychopathic game with no friends or family, just as much as you can't grant any warmth or comfort in a locked clustered basement underneath laminate flooring and wood fitted with carpet.
I would like to take a moment to ask you, the reader, what would you do in this situation? Got an answer? Good, because I can guarantee you my response was much worse.

It was Monday 14th July 1998 at around 3PM when I finished the school day, the sun was gleaming down onto my spotty and greasy face leaving me with heat annoyance and a brush of sweat on the top of my forehead.
I continued to walk, with no enthusiasm from my bruised body. What could possibly be wrong? I walked so miserably because I knew in at least twenty minutes or so my bruises would become cuts and then evolve into blood stains.
Like magic? My copy of Bad Rats would say after he pasted my face into a whole new appearance. If only he knew what was coming to him.
I soon walked upon my house, oh how I can remember them dark days up in my room. My stomach felt like blood beaten butterflies floating motionlessly in my unfed stomach.
I swallowed. I took a second swallow.
My heart was beating in such an inconsistent manner it made me feel sick. He made me feel sick.
With one last gulp I proceeded toward the house, but then, the oddest object occurrence entered my view. Laying there on the summer green grass was the object that would change my life for both the better and worse.
My mother used to slit her wrists with the very same object until she ended up taking her own life to escape this tragedy that we all refer to as `life.`
Only I wasn't taking my own life, I was taking Bad Rats life. I scooped the object up with pure determination and raged anger.
I will avenge my darling mother even if it is the last thing I do.
I clutched down the door handle like a psychopathic lunatic until I entered onto the hallway.
“Is that you boy? Because I've got a big surprise waiting for you!”
So have I, you dirty faced prick, I thought almost seemingly out loud.
I heard his trying to be intimidating footsteps from his groggy rats come closer... And closer.
He towered over me, glaring at me through his black rat eyes.
“Ain’t you gonna ask what it is, you ungrateful brat!” He exclaimed cockily, making himself stand more straight in a proud sort of manner.
“I was just gonna ask you the same thing. Bat Rats.”
With a flow of confidence, I slid out the knife from beneath my left sleeve, I impulsively rushed the knife into his stomach just about 2cm below his chest,
He screamed out in shock and pain, his legs buckled as the blood trickled down to his purposely ripped jeans.
“Or would you prefer me to call you noob, you prick!”
I grinned like a little child on my birthday, the blood squirting out of him like a fountain made me feel in control, made me feel powerful.
“Y-you a-a-ain't gett-ing a-away fr-fr-from m-me!”
My game crashed, trying to approach me, trying to end me.

10/10 GOTY

reviewText:
So..Bad Rats. This is a game where you play as a team of rats devoted to brutally murdering the little kitty. Although many people say it's not a very good game, there are some aspects that are quite entertaining and well thought out.

The design and care put into the character models of the rats is quite remarkable. I giggled when I first saw the bomb rat's model. The physics in the game are amazing! Almost as good as Star Wars. The game also comes up with a lot of good ways to kill kitty.

This game should not be called bad rats cuz the rats are good.

Rating: 10/10 would buy again
voteText: 4 of 4 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Por fin los ratones cumpliran su venganza después de tantos años de acoso por parte de los gatos. Bad rats te dara el control para torturar de muchas maneras diferentes a los pobres gatos que estan atrapados en el campo de tortura de las propias ratas. Para ellos usaremos el arsenal que las propias ratas tienen para despedazar, triturar o decapitar a los pobres felinos.

Juego completado al 100%

Lo bueno:
-Gran variedad de mapas con diferentes metodos de tortura
-Bastante sangriento cuando completas al trampa
-Muy entretenido y adictivo
-Puzzles (trampas) dificiles de montar donde le daras muchas vueltas al coco para hacer torturar a los gatos
-Mucho colorido que le da un toque agradable
-Funcionalidad y jugabilidad sencilla
-Tiene cromos
-Tiene trofeos

Lo malo:
-No recomendado para pequeños
-Los sonidos no son muy agradables y la banda sonora suele ser repetitiva

Puntuación total: 8,8

reviewText:
Holy ♥♥♥♥ this game is an absoloute masterpeice of technology, whoever made this is a living god and should be reqarded The Nobel Peace Prize.

The graphics are ♥♥♥♥ing awesome the cartoony graphics make it feel like a cartoon while at the same time the shdows and shaders on the rats make it seem some what realistic.

The soundtrack is just absoloute perfection giving me goosebumps at times which i rarely get and at intence parts genuinely scaring me! I cant see any faults in the soundtrack.Just amazing...

The gameplay is the best part.The difficult puzzles get me really frustrated at times but when i solved them it was the most rewarding thing i think ive ever felt in life.     It makes me believe that we really have hit the pinnacle of technology and gaming.Its going to take a hell of alot to beat this game and no one will be doing that any time soon.It really makes me think will games get any better than this, i remember playing super mario on my cousins NES and thinking Holy ♥♥♥♥ this is the most amazing thing mankind have ever created and ever will
date: its over theres literally no point in playing games anymore if ive allready played a perfect one" But then one day i logged onto steam and bought this gem.\n\nThe menus in this game are just peices of pure ♥♥♥♥ing art
recommended: now you might say that art is subjective or its your own opinion but i ♥♥♥♥ing dare  you to find a picture of the Bad Rats title screen and not faint. I ♥♥♥♥ you not this is better than any peice of art that has been and gone in this world.\n\nDont even get me started on the cutscenes
hoursPlayed:
i swear to good ill ♥♥♥♥ing pass out and have a ♥♥♥♥ing seizure.There just something down right special i actually thought i was watching Shawshank redemption at one point but then as the cutscene faded i saw the face that i came to love.

This game is ♥♥♥♥ing great 9.9/10 (I dont believe in a PERFECT game) buy it and youll never look at your computer the same way again. I even wanked over this game at one point.

Lol jk tho this game is a peice of ♥♥♥♥...

reviewText:
Pros:
Fantastic visuals
Challenging puzzles
User friendly & intuitive GUI
Excellent soundtrack

Cons:
Takes up too much space (200 mb? What the ♥♥♥♥?)
Is extremely demanding (My 780 could hardly run this!)
Extremely graphic! My stomach absolutely turned when I saw that realistic and detailed cat explode!

The verdict: Bad Rats: The Rats' Revenge is a great game from the highly renowned developer Invent4 Entertainment. Although its NSFW and is too graphic for children, it is definitely on par with classics such as Battletoads on NES and Bubsy 3D for the Playstation as well as The Legends Zedlo for the Nentendo. This title is a huge contender for GOTY 2014. I am excited to see what the developers have planned for Bad Rats 3.

reviewText: I have heard from multiple sources that Intel is coming out with a new type of Central Processing Unit that is capable of running Bad Rats at 320 x 200 @ 15fps. The problem is, I'm not sure if Intel has the technology or the resources required to manufacture in mass quantities a highly advanced technological device; we simply just do not have the current knowledge to understand the deep underlying processes of Bad Rats very effectively without examining the inner workings of the brain that exists within the creator's head. There is even a rumor circulating the internet that Intel might also be trying to include a 13 FoV option. We are arriving into an age of photorealism, my fellow gentlemen. We are now going to receive a field of vision that completely surpassess what we can normally see, a framerate so smooth and fast that we will be unable to detect anymore differences in the stuttering and jaggedness of animation, and a resolution so ravishing that we will be completely unable to work out even the smallest of graphical irregularities thanks to the near-microscopic capabilities of digital imagery. It is only a matter of time before all of this becomes a reality, we must simply be patient for times to come.

reviewText: Best 20 minutes of my life. During the steam summer sale I decided I needed a good game in my life. After many hours of slaving away trying to earn 19 cents for this game I had finally done it. Once I launched the game I knew my hard work had payed off. While in-game my girlfriend broke up with me, the doctor called to tell me I had aids, ebola, and cancer, and pneumonic plague. As I continued through the game after that devastating news I also got a phone call stating that my electricity bill had skyrocketed and that I owed 20000 dollars. As soon as my 20 minutes hit my computer screen sizzled and cracked and the glass shattered, which stabbed both of my eyes and made me blind, the computer sent out jolts of electricty to everywhere on my body, it then continued by emitting a very high noise breaking both my eardrums, the computer then blew up and sent shards of computer shrapnel through my body giving me permanent brain damage. But what can I say? It was totally worth the 19 cents and the joy I had playing it was well worth my forever blindness, deafness and my cancer, ebola, and aids.\n\n10/10 Would Sacrifice My Body Parts Again!

reviewText: Well, after completing it, I can say that this game is extremely underrated. I think that the hate comes because of the theme of the game. Yeah, the story is weird and morbid: The rats are killing cats in Mortal Kombat Style. But, I dont understand why all the hate becuase of the storyline? Conker from Conker's Bad Fur Day is a squirell that drinks beer and pisses on people made of rock and nobody complained about it. Anyway, let's switch to the actual review.\nThe concept is great: you use your rats, barrel, baloon, umbrela, trampoline, box and a plank to push the ball to the trap that kills the cat. You have to place your rats and objects on the level in paused mode and then hope for the best in play" mode. The levels can be solved in a really many ways
date: which is really great because it takes your creativity to the test.  At the beggining of the level
recommended: you are given hints and map plan
voteText: so I would recommend turning off the map plan and not reading the hints. The hints and map plans are only helpful in first four levels
helpfulPercent: but later they become less useful. Also
votesHelpful: the hints are written in much worse English than my own.\nThe rats are fun(ny) to watch
votesTotal: esspecially the Terrorist rats. Their idling animation and design are just hillarious.\nThe graphics are bad
votesFunny: even for an 2009 indie game. There are only few graphical options that doesnt improve graphics at all.\nBut
commentsCount: the thing that ruins this great concept is the gameplay itself. This game is also known
column16: besides for it's theme
column17: for the random physics. Early in the review
column18: I said "hope for the best" and now it's the time to explain you what does that mean. Every time you press the play button
column19: something different happends. Some levels even requires pure luck
column20: which means tapping play buttons until your combination of object and rats works. That just suck
column21: but it isnt that bad.\nAt the end
column22: we can conclude that this is one underrated game. It is a bad game
column23: but by bad I mean hillariously bad. It's definetly not the worst game
column24: there are many worse titles in the Steam store. You can find this game at the trading sites for a really cheap prices and this game is often going 90% off
column25: so it's definetly worth the price of 0.39 euros."

reviewText: Most may be wondering if they should play Bad Rats, but the real question is: Are you ready to dive into the imersive experience that is Bad Rats? After playing this game for about 30 minutes, it took all my will power to pull myself away from this game inorder to write this review. Thus far in my Bad Rats journey I have already achieved spiritual enlightenment. This beautiful, under-priced visual stimulant is truely the game of the century. Be prepared to lose yourself in this expansive world as you explore the hidden lore of this timeless journey to kill cats. Alot of deep themes are expressed through this game. If you are faint of heart or bravery, do not play this game. This game is only for the strong. If you are willing, Bad Rats, will reward you. Friends will be jealous of your massive high score, woman will want to be with you, men will want to be you. If you truely believe that you, yes you! Are ready for the experience of a lifetime, then pay the minimal price of 20 cents and your time. It was well worth it.\n

reviewText: Bad Rats: the Rats' Revenge is an ambitious masterpiece, it succeeds greatly in every single aspect.\nBad Rats is a dating sim where you play as a group of attractive young teens who call themselves the Bad Rats" (Play the game to find out why! c:) Throughout the game your main goal is to seduce a woman from a group known as the "Cats”. Eventually a rival gang shows up and you’ll be rather shocked at who the members are
date: you’ll have to take out your revenge on them (thus the amazingly witty title)! The writing in this game is top notch
recommended: it's just as good as  hit games such as The Walking Dead
voteText: Sam and Max
helpfulPercent: and Sonic Boom; Rise of Lyric. The graphics are absolutely astonishing
votesHelpful:
I was convinced I really was there chatting it up with a beautiful woman. Overall this game gave me an experience of pure euphoria. This is a great dating sim to play if you’re new to the genre and it's a classic for veterans of the genre. I could not recommend Bad Rats more!

Breakdown:

Pros
Astonishing Graphics
Beautiful Women
Amazing Writing
Smooth 120 FPS
Induces Feelings of Pure Euphoria

Cons
This game is worth WAY more than 99 cents

reviewText: I sit in misery, looking for any sign of hope. I scroll through my long list of steam games, looking for an answer to the pain. Out of the corner of my eye I see it. A game sent to me as a mere gag, but surely, surely there was something special behind the jest. Something wonderful. I install the game. I hit play. As the game loads up I'm greeted with music. I listen, eyes closed. In a whispering moment, My lips curl into a smile, my heart beats in rhythm, my head sways side to side. Could this be my shining light in a sea of misery, I ask myself. Tears roll down onto my cheeks. I take a dip breath and start a new game. Which I instantly regretted doing because holy ♥♥♥♥ this game is probably one of the worst games I've played since super granny. Good soundtrack though. 10/10

reviewText:
. . . AMIDST all the crises under which we suffer and which do but present a single connected picture, perhaps that which the people feels most acutely is the economic crisis. The political crisis, the moral crisis, are only very rarely felt by the individual. The average man sees in the experiences of his day not that which affects the community as a whole but for the most part only that which strikes himself. Therefore the present has only very rarely any consciousness of political or moral collapse, so long as this collapse does not extend in one way or another into economic life. For when this happens it is no longer a question of some abstract problem that can perhaps be observed or studied in its effect on others, but one day the individual himself will be caught hold of by this question, and the more intimately such a crisis begins to influence his own life, the more clearly does he come to recognize that existing conditions cannot remain as they are. Then all of a sudden people talk of economic distress, of economic misery, and then, starting from this distress, one can awaken an understanding for that other distress which otherwise is wont to remain for a long time hidden from the individual man.

It is not enough to say that the German economic distress is a phenomenon resulting from a world crisis, from a general economic distress, since, of course, exactly in the same way every other people could plead the same excuse, could adduce the same reason. It is clear that even so this distress cannot have its roots all over the world, those roots must always be found within the life of peoples. And though only one thing is probably true - that these roots are perhaps the same in the case of many peoples - yet one cannot hope to master this distress by the mere statement that the presence of a certain distress is a feature of the age; rather it is clearly a necessity to disclose these roots in the internal life of a single people and to cure the distress there where one can really effect a cure.

Unfortunately it is precisely the German who is only too inclined at such times, instead of looking at his own internal life, to let his gaze range into the far distance. Our people has been so long falsely taught to think in international terms that even in such a distress as the present it tends to treat this problem, too, from international points of view. And the result is that many of us simply cannot believe that perhaps it might be possible to remedy such a misfortune in some other way than by international methods. And yet that is an error. It is natural that international infirmities which afflict all peoples in one way or another must be removed by the peoples who suffer from them, but that in no way alters the fact that every people must wage this battle on its own behalf, and above all that no single people can be liberated from this distress by international methods if it does not for its own part take the necessary measures. These measures can, of course, find their place within the framework of international measures, but one's own action must not be made dependent upon the action of others.

The crisis in German economics is not merely a crisis which is expressed by our economic statistics, but it is above all a crisis which can also be traced in the internal course of our economic life, in the character of its organization, etc. And here we can indeed speak of a crisis which has hit our people more severely than other peoples. It is the crisis which we see in the relations between capital, economics, and people. This crisis is particularly obvious in the relations between our workmen and the employers. Here the crisis has been more acute than in any other country in the world....

The first cause lies in the alteration in the form of business organization which determined the character of our economics. That cause may be traced throughout the world precisely as in Germany....

The gradual alienation of classes which we in Germany experienced led to the appearance on the one side of the special interests of the employers and on the other side the special interests of the employed. This was the beginning of our unhappy economic development. When one had once started on this road, of necessity the two sides became ever more widely separated. Here a law governs human affairs: when one has once chosen the wrong road this road always leads one further from reason.

On the contrary, the road led necessarily to further alienation and this tendency, as I said, was favored by the depersonalization of property. And I might almost say that this process was apparently still further encouraged and strengthened on scientific grounds. There gradually arose an ideology which believed that it could permanently support the conception of property even though those who derived any practical profit from the conception no longer represented more than a minimal percentage of the nation. And on the other hand there arose the view that, since there was now only so small a percentage of those who enjoyed property, the conception of private property as such should be abandoned....

When one has once started on this course, then logically the employers will in turn form their organization. And as a matter of course these two organizations will not pursue their own ends in mutual toleration, but they will maintain their apparently separate interests with those weapons which are given them: viz, lockouts and strikes. In this warfare sometimes one and sometimes the other side will conquer. But in either case it is the whole nation which will have to pay the cost of this warfare and suffer the damage. And the final result of this development is that these organizations as they build themselves up, considering the passion of the German for bureaucratization, will continuously become more unwieldy and their personnel will grow constantly larger. And at length the organization will no longer serve the interests of its creators, but these will be subservient to the organization, so that the warfare is continued in order that the existence of the organization may be justified, even though at times reason suddenly comes and says; 'The whole affair is madness; the gain when compared with the sacrifices is positively ludicrous. If you reckon up the sacrifices which we make for the organization they are far greater than any possible profit.' Then the organizations in their turn will have to prove how necessary they are by stirring up the parties to fight each other. And then it may even be that the two organizations come to an understanding, when once they have realized the situation.

The second reason is the rise of Marxism. Marxism, as a conception of the world with disintegration for its aim, saw with keen insight that the trade-union movement offered it the possibility in the future of conducting its attack against the State and against human society with an absolutely annihilating weapon. Not with any idea of helping the worker -what is the worker of any country to these apostles of internationalism? Nothing at all! They never see him! They themselves are no workers: they are alien litterateurs, an alien gang! . . .

One had to inoculate the trade union with the idea: You are an instrument of the class war and that war in the last resort can find its political leaders only in Marxism. What is then more comprehensible than that one should also pay one's tribute to the leadership? And the tribute was exacted in full measure. These gentlemen have not been content with a tithe: they demanded a considerably higher rate of interest.

This class war leads to the proclamation of the trade union as simply an instrument for the representation of the economic interests of the working classes and therewith for the purposes of the general strike. Thus the general strike appears for the first time as a means for exercising political power and shows what Marxism really hoped to gain fr

This game is simply amazing. The amount of levels and distinc challenges make the gameplay simply a joy.

The puzzle element is on par with the portal series, with each puzzle making you think to your full potential, and the unique characters involve you with the cartoon violence style.

reviewText:
I can't explain the utter emotion and the euphoria i experienced whilst playing bad rats,
I'll begin with the story telling.
Never before has a game come so close to making me cry. And i have played most telltale games. This game transcends perfectly, what it is like to grow up in the ghetto as a cat was like. This hit very close to me, and many more, creating an amazing and emotional aura around me whilst i played this game. It brang a tear to my eye as i saw (SPOILER ALERT)  the cat get microwaved.

Next, the graphics. When was the last time your eyes saw something that looks this real to life? Probably when you went outisde all them weeks ago. This keeps me up to date on what life looks like after 7 weeks of playing bad rats non stop, only taking time out to write this review. Almost good as real life

The gameplay reminds me of battlefield 4, but 3rd person. The puzzles do a great job of immersing me in the deep deep universe, which i still need to learn about (Like when dookaboo cat ordered the rats to be killed, thus why the rats want revenge), and keep you playing for hours without end!

I overall rate this game 18/10 very nice game, would get a 20 if there were books to read to learn the lore

reviewText:
There are certain words so powerful that any critic has to be very careful about using them. Among those words, there is none more dangerous than “perfect.” Yet I've previously and quite brazenly used it to describe Bad Rats, and I still stand by the statement today. That’s not just about Bad Rats' game mechanics--though those are sublime. Despite the limitless possibilities of games, very few ever present something genuinely, radically new or demand a fresh way of thinking about the world. Bad Rats does both, exploring its concepts with gratifying depth and flawless pacing.

To do that would be enough, but Bad Rats also binds the intellectual seamlessly with the emotional, crafting a sumptuously warm, human, funny, and terrifying story as a welcoming channel into its heady concepts. INVENT4's masterpiece blends game mechanics and character development to a startlingly affecting degree, constantly bolstering one with the other to create an utterly complete and fulfilling whole. Forget the brief running time. A second longer would be an ill-judged extravagance. Bad Rats is a precision-engineered masterpiece from start to finish. It is, simply, perfect.

reviewText: Bad Rats: the Rats' Revenge combines three unique game modes: Campaign, Multiplayer and Zombies, providing fans with the deepest and most ambitious Bad Rats ever. The Campaign has been designed as a co-op game that can be played with up to 4 players online or as a solo cinematic thrill-ride. Multiplayer will be the franchise’s deepest, most rewarding and most engaging to date, with new ways to rank up, customize, and gear up for battle. And Zombies delivers an all-new mind-blowing experience with its own dedicated narrative. Bad Rats: the Rats' Revenge can be played entirely online, and for the first time each of the offerings has its own unique player XP and progression systems. The title ushers in an unprecedented level of innovation, including jaw-dropping environments, never before experienced weaponry and abilities, and the introduction of a new, improved fluid movement system. All of this is brought to life by advanced technology custom crafted for this title, including new AI and animation systems, and graphics that redefine the standards Bad Rats fans have come to expect from the critically-acclaimed series, with cutting edge lighting systems and visual effects.
