reviewText:
Compelling and immersive, emergent gameplay brought about by the innovative dynamic physics engine never before seen elsewhere in any other game quite like Bad Rats.

A masterpiece beyond compare, this gem in the rough promises hours of brain bending puzzles you'll endlessly attempt to solve. Sporting loads of challenging achievements and metered statistics, you will be constantly tweaking and improving your solutions to perfection. The included Expert mode allows for custom setups on the old, recommended yet restricted loadouts for truly limitless creative design.

Every time this exquisite piece of software goes on sale, another friend on my list gains a copy. I received one myself as a gift, and I've also shared the surprise several times over to this day. I highly recommend doing the same!
voteText: 6 of 8 people (75%) found this review helpful

reviewText: One of the most breathtaking releases of this millenium, a true work of art, Bad Rats, despite using HANDSOME rats for it's protagonists, manages to comment extensively on the human psyche, while presenting an array of characters who comment on the nature of anthropocentricism, psychology, sexuality, philosophy, mortality,  morals, and a society at it's core. A Lord of The Rats, if you will, presented stylishly in an interactive medium. And you see, it can only work as a game, the choices you make in the game, such as whether you kill Carlo the Rat, and whether you decide to spare Marlita the Cat, a former rat who was mistreated by their boss, truly do effect the story, and this game has more endings than any other game I've seen; 420 ENDINGS! Each of which is entirely different! No recolours! No same amounts of X! There are different characters, different objects, different locations, and different weapons, and even different amount of marijiuana in kush rat's bong each time!!! Wow! My mind was blown game of the year!

reviewText:
5min of this game. i turned off the blood and gibs so it would be less violent for sensitive people.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QITC7s4oJvg

this is a puzzle game where rats think up overly complex ways to take out cats in 44 levels.
each level your given a set number of items and rats and you need to figure out how to use them to eliminate the cat.
easy has a overlay showing you what to do but most levels have a few ways of completing them.
the physics can be random and you can get very different results by just hitting play and not moving anything.
i would not suggest this game if your adverse to cat violence because with blood and gibs it can get kinda gruesome but i think most will be fine.

reviewText:
Let me quickly tell you a long story about a man I knew.. His name was Timmy.

Now, Timmy was a young, average man. Loving life to the fullest, had a wonderful life, a couple wives, and a single, loving kid. His special young boy by the name of-- Doot Doot. You may be thinking to yourself; 'What kind of mentally-challenged man would name their child such a STUPID ♥♥♥♥ing thing?' Well, young boys and girls, that man was none other than you.

Yes, YOU. You may not know it, but it's true. You could also be saying to yourself; 'I DON'T EVEN HAVE A CHILD! THE FLYING ♥♥♥♥ ARE YOU TALKING ABOUT?!' To put it simply, friends.

Bad Rats.

Best game, 10/10.

reviewText:
The community of this game is so ironic that the real opinions fade to the never-ending sea of jokes and parodies. It's horrible, I would've not thought it possible, but here we are.

Bad Rats is unique. It attempts to be something similiar to games like Angry Birds or Spelunky by creating a theme that's quite comical. Rats killing cats. It's like from an old children's movie. Though this attempt is unsuccesful and the game comes out as a weird experiment which still provides some challenge, though.

The graphics are horrible, the gameplay is not what you desire and the game is spoiled with extreme stereotypes and racism. Soundtrack is decent and provides variety, but the game is rather repetitive.

But the extreme forte of this game is the price. I recommend one purchases it when it's on sale, for then the game usually costs less than a dollar/euro. During sales this game becomes one of the cheapest games in Steam. This game, providing enough gameplay to fulfill the discounted price when it IS discounted, makes it a pretty decent game to compete with other puzzle games.
voteText: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText: When I first launched Bad Rats: the Rat's Revenge, a beam shot from my computer screen. It turned me into a rat. My keen senses then directed me to the nearest cat and I had a sense of bloodshed. My first instinct was to scroll slowly over to it at 1-2 FPS and bulldozer it off a nearby bomb shelter. I always loved it when the cat's blood spilled in 3000 pieces, including his stupid yellow brain. I was rewarded not only with cheese, but with cat blood spewing from his mouth. I now reside in a swaggy alleyway with 3 wives and super pimped out kids. I teach them my hunting tecniques. They learn. We spread. I prosper. Buy this game and we shall show dominince over these evil felines! VIVA LA RATS!
